## JsPlumbInstance class

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare abstract class JsPlumbInstance<T extends {
    E: unknown;
} = any> extends EventGenerator 
```
<b>Extends:</b> EventGenerator

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [\_appendElement(el, parent)](./core.jsplumbinstance._appendelement) |  |  |
|  [\_applyRotations(point, rotations)](./core.jsplumbinstance._applyrotations) |  | Applies the given set of Rotations to the given point, and returns a new PointXY. For internal use. |
|  [\_applyRotationsXY(point, rotations)](./core.jsplumbinstance._applyrotationsxy) |  | Applies the given set of Rotations to the given point, and returns a new PointXY. For internal use. |
|  [\_createSourceDefinition(params, referenceParams)](./core.jsplumbinstance._createsourcedefinition) |  |  |
|  [\_deriveEndpointAndAnchorSpec(type, dontPrependDefault)](./core.jsplumbinstance._deriveendpointandanchorspec) |  | For internal use. For the given inputs, derive an appropriate anchor and endpoint definition. |
|  [\_finaliseConnection(jpc, params, originalEvent)](./core.jsplumbinstance._finaliseconnection) |  | Adds the connection to the backing model, fires an event if necessary and then redraws. This is a package-private method, not intended to be called by external code.  \_finaliseConnection |
|  [\_getAssociatedElements(el)](./core.jsplumbinstance._getassociatedelements) |  | For some given element, find any other elements we want to draw whenever that element is being drawn. for groups, for example, this means any child elements of the group. For an element that has child elements that are also managed, it means those child elements. |
|  [\_getRotation(elementId)](./core.jsplumbinstance._getrotation) |  | Gets the current rotation for the element with the given ID. This method exists for internal use. |
|  [\_getRotations(elementId)](./core.jsplumbinstance._getrotations) |  | Returns a list of rotation transformations that apply to the given element. An element may have rotation applied directly to it, and/or it may be within a group, which may itself be rotated, and that group may be inside a group which is also rotated, etc. It's rotated turtles all the way down, or at least it could be. This method is intended for internal use only. |
|  [\_idstamp()](./core.jsplumbinstance._idstamp) |  |  |
|  [\_internal\_newEndpoint(params)](./core.jsplumbinstance._internal_newendpoint) |  | Internal method to create an Endpoint from the given options, perhaps with the given id. Do not use this method as a consumer of the API. If you wish to add an Endpoint to some element, use <code>addEndpoint</code> instead. |
|  [\_maybePruneEndpoint(endpoint)](./core.jsplumbinstance._maybepruneendpoint) |  | Potentially delete the endpoint from the instance, depending on the endpoint's internal state. Not for external use. |
|  [\_newConnection(params)](./core.jsplumbinstance._newconnection) |  | Creates and registers a new connection. For internal use only. Use <code>connect</code> to create Connections. |
|  [\_removeElement(el)](./core.jsplumbinstance._removeelement) |  |  |
|  [addClass(el, clazz)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addclass) |  |  |
|  [addConnectorClass(connector, clazz)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addconnectorclass) |  |  |
|  [addEndpoint(el, params, referenceParams)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addendpoint) |  | Add an Endpoint to the given element.  addEndpoint |
|  [addEndpointClass(ep, c)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addendpointclass) |  |  |
|  [addEndpoints(el, endpoints, referenceParams)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addendpoints) |  | Add a set of Endpoints to an element |
|  [addGroup(params)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addgroup) |  |  |
|  [addOverlayClass(o, clazz)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addoverlayclass) |  |  |
|  [addSourceSelector(selector, params, exclude)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addsourceselector) |  | Registers a selector for connection drag on the instance. This is a newer version of the <code>makeSource</code> functionality that has been in jsPlumb since the early days. With this approach, rather than calling <code>makeSource</code> on every element, you can register a CSS selector on the instance that identifies something that is common to your elements. This will only respond to mouse events on elements that are managed by the instance. |
|  [addTargetSelector(selector, params, exclude)](./core.jsplumbinstance.addtargetselector) |  | Registers a selector for connection drag on the instance. This is a newer version of the <code>makeTarget</code> functionality that has been in jsPlumb since the early days. With this approach, rather than calling <code>makeTarget</code> on every element, you can register a CSS selector on the instance that identifies something that is common to your elements. This will only respond to mouse events on elements that are managed by the instance. |

|  [applyConnectorType(connector, t)](./core.jsplumbinstance.applyconnectortype) |  |  |

|  [makeConnector(connection, name, args)](./core.jsplumbinstance.makeconnector) |  |  |
|  [manage(element, internalId, \_recalc)](./core.jsplumbinstance.manage) |  | Manage an element. Adds the element to the viewport and sets up tracking for endpoints/connections for the element, as well as enabling dragging for the element. This method is called internally by various methods of the jsPlumb instance, such as <code>connect</code>, <code>addEndpoint</code>, <code>makeSource</code> and <code>makeTarget</code>, so if you use those methods to setup your UI then you may not need to call this. However, if you use the <code>addSourceSelector</code> and <code>addTargetSelector</code> methods to configure your UI then you will need to register elements using this method, or they will not be draggable. |
|  [manageAll(elements, recalc)](./core.jsplumbinstance.manageall) |  | Manage a group of elements. |

If you want to first recompute element size and position you should call <code>revalidate(el)</code> instead,  repaint |
|  [repaintEverything()](./core.jsplumbinstance.repainteverything) |  | Repaint every connection and endpoint in the instance.  repaintEverything |
|  [reset()](./core.jsplumbinstance.reset) |  | Clears all endpoints and connections from the instance of jsplumb. Does not also clear out event listeners, selectors, or connection/endpoint types - for that, use <code>destroy()</code>. |
|  [restoreDefaults()](./core.jsplumbinstance.restoredefaults) |  |  |
|  [revalidate(el, timestamp)](./core.jsplumbinstance.revalidate) |  | Updates position/size information for the given element and redraws its Endpoints and their Connections. Use this method when you've made a change to some element that may have caused the element to change its position or size and you want to ensure the connections are in the right place.  revalidate |
|  [rotate(element, rotation, \_doNotRepaint)](./core.jsplumbinstance.rotate) |  | Sets rotation for the element to the given number of degrees (not radians). A value of null is treated as a rotation of 0 degrees.  rotate |
